DataElement.preferredName: Esophagus Normal Tissue Location Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of the anatomic location of a matching normal tissue sample from the esophagus.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Esophagus Normal Tissue Location Anatomic Site
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach._Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI)_An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found._Named locations of, or within, the body.

It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach.
